# What Is A Corporate Photographer?

Corporate Headshot PhotographerDallas Corporate Photographer

Apr 1

Written By Jason Kindig

There are so many different types of photography out there, and I know that it
can be confusing to understand the specialties of some. So I figured I would
dedicate a few blogs to breaking down exactly what certain photographers do.
Today we are going to look at the life of a Dallas corporate photographer, and
see what all they are up to day in and day out.

So what does a corporate photographer in Dallas do? Well, the short answer is
that they are specialized in shooting for businesses. Whereas other
photographic specialties may be focused on helping to market a product or
service, corporate photography usually carries more of an emphasis on the
people and places behind these products and services.

Contact Jason Today

Though the needs can be fairly broad, I’ve found that most corporate
photography needs are focused in three areas:

 **Headshots –**

Most of the corporate work that I do ends up on the web. Whether it’s for a
company website, intranet or social media presence, the vast majority of
content that I create is destined for online. Headshots are no exception.

Dallas headshot photography is one of the most popular services offered by a
corporate photographer, and is arguably the most important.

After all, it puts a face to a name when you are looking at people you want to
do business for. I’ve had clients tell me about their clients selecting them
after looking at their headshot and comparing it to others, so there is a lot
of power in letting people see your face.

**Portraits –**

For corporate, I generally keep the portrait category a bit loose. There are
generally two flavors of photography that fall into this area: posed and
candid. Some clients want a shot of their CEO, team or combination in a posed
manner, either in the office or at a location that speaks to what they do or
the area where they are doing business.

Or, they want images that show members of the team collaborating or
interacting with customers. This helps to show how a company approaches its
work, and what the office dynamics are both amongst its own people and in the
interactions with clients. There are a lot of companies that like to get a
combination of these flavors so that they can mix it up across the different
pages of their website.

**Interiors –**

This is the final area that most Dallas corporate photographers handle for
clients. By documenting their office environment, it can be very helpful for a
company to illustrate what kind of experience their clients will have when
working for them. It can go a long way in showing that they are professional,
top notch, a place that is calm and relaxing, or whatever specific feeling the
company is trying to evoke. For instance, if you were going to a medical
facility, you want to see a place that looks clean, contemporary, but also
warm and inviting. A corporate photographer would be the one to show your
facility in the best light possible. It is even a differentiating factor if
you have a space that has been recently remodeled, very unique, or contain
certain modern amenities. Your competition may not be as up to date with their
offerings, and it can really set you apart.

So as you can see, a Dallas corporate photographer is focused on helping show
the people and places that provide great services and experiences. People like
to be familiar with the people they are going to do business with, and they
like to see the environment they will be working in as well. A Dallas
corporate photographer is the one who can bring both of these aspects to
light.

Jason Kindig
